column2: By recruiting more University Scientists to work for the government we can increase our research capability.
By recruiting more independent scientists we can increase our research capability.

World War II was the first time in history that science was given massive support by governments.  This led to science projects with virtually unlimited budgets and many breakthrough technologies resulted because of massive government commitments.

World War II was the first war that involved high sophisticated machines and weapons and by using scientific methods for analysis on how best to employ these new advanced weapons systems their effectiveness could be multiplied.  For example, deriving a new scientific formula for how best to find U-boats using search patterns and radar.

The Homeland was an important front during World War II because it was the first war that involved civilian populations on a national scale.  Civilians were effected by bombings, rationing, and production.
In modern warfare, the morale on the homefront can be crucial to how well soldiers perform on the front lines.

Wartime rationing was a good way to allocate scarce resources for the war effort.  In America and Great Britain, many luxuries had to be done without in order to help with the service men fighting at the front.  For example women stopped wearing nylon pantyhose, tin and scrap metal was collected, bacon grease was saved for the production of explosives and so on, national speed limits were imposed on private automobile owners in order to save gas for the war effort, and so on.

The Second World War was the first war in history to see the mass production of medicine never before seen.  Penicillin was vital for troops fighting in distant and remote parts of the world, where bacteria and exotic diseases could wreak havoc on troops.
Blood Transfusions were never performed on a massive scale before like they were in World War II.  Blood Transfusions saved countless lives of wounded soldiers.

The Combat Battlefield Medic came into his own during World War II.  The Combat Medic could perform advanced first aid right on the battlefield before the wounded soldier even reached the triage station.  Medics during World War II saved countless lives.

The field of Aviation Medicine was a virtually brand new field of medicine at the start of World War II.  Never before had the psychological and physicological effects of flight been studying on humans on a massive scale.  Aviation Medicine led to advances such as oxygen masks, g-suits, heated flight suits, and so on.

The field of nutrition on the battlefield made a huge leap in technology.  The American Army designed a ration designed to give soldiers a high amount of calories in a small package.  This led to the K-Ration, it packed 1,500 calories and didn't taste too bad.
Accepting civilian volunteers and giving them minimal military training is a good way to raise a basic defense force.  For offense, you will need to train professional soldiers though.
Increase the level of Basic Training with this tech.  This is the Boot Camp that all new recruits need to go through in order to enter the armed forces.
This is the basic infantry school for graduates of Basic Training.  Here they will learn squad tactics, land navigation, defense, and assault on a basic level.
This is the basic school for artillery men.  Here they will learn about ballistics, breakdown and movement of field artillery, and how to fire some different barrage types.
This is the basic school for tank operators.  Here they will learn about basic mechanics of tanks, how to drive them, how to fire the weapons, and how operate tank radios.
This is the basic flight school for training pilots.  Here they will learn how takeoff and land their airplane, basic weather, basic aerial navigation, and basic flight manuevers.
This is the basic school for those Air Force personnel who will become the mechanics who will repair and maintain the Air Forces aircraft.
This is the basic school where sailors will learn their rate from being a boatswain to a torpedoman.

Getting supplies from point A to point B itself, imposes a cost in supplies.  However, if we develop new vehicles and improve organisation for our transports, then the act of transporting supplies will consume fewer of them during transport.
column3: Transporter des ressources d'un point A à un point B consomme des ressources. Cependant, si nous développons de nouveaux véhicules et une nouvelle organisation pour nos transports, transporter des ressources consommera alors moins de ressources.
column4: Der Nachschubtransport von A nach B allein verbraucht schon Nachschubmittel. Würden wir jedoch neue Transportfahrzeuge entwickeln und eine neue Nachschuborganisation aufstellen, könnten wir den Nachschubverbrauch des Nachschubtransports reduzieren.
column6: Llevar suministros de A a B consume recursos de por sí. Sin embargo, si desarrollamos nuevos vehículos y mejoramos la organización para nuestros transportes, el traslado de suministros consumirá menos recursos.

column2: There are only so many supplies we can move along any individual road or railway.  However, with better organisation we can increase that level, and this can be achieved by assigning teams to study the current state of our supply organisation.
column3: Nous pouvons déjà déplacer une quantité considérable de ravitaillement le long d'une unique route ou d'une unique ligne de chemin de fer. Cependant, grâce à une meilleure organisation, nous pourrons augmenter cette quantité. Nous pourrons y parvenir en désignant des équipes pour qu'elle étudient l'organisation de notre ravitaillement.
column4: Der Nachschubtransport über Straßen oder Schienenstrecken ist limitiert. Wenn wir unsere Organisation jedoch verbessern würde, könnten wir dieses Limit erhöhen. Dazu müssten wir Forschungsgruppen zur Untersuchung unserer derzeitigen Nachschuborganisation abstellen.
column6: Hay un número limitado de suministros que pueden transportarse por una carretera o ferrocarril. Aun así, con una mejor organización, podremos aumentar ese límite, y eso solo puede conseguirse asignando equipos al estudio del actual estado de la organización de los suministros.

column2: Any plane, ship or vehicle will take damage at some point.  If we research civil defense it will allow us to better organise our home-front to repair equipment and reinforce our troops.
column3: N'importe quel avion, navire ou véhicule subira des dégâts au bout d'un certain temps. Si nous effectuons des recherches dans le domaine de la défense civile, cela nous permettra de mieux organiser notre front intérieur pour la réparation et la consolidation de nos troupes.
column4: Jedes Flugzeug, Schiff oder Fahrzeug wird früher oder später beschädigt. Durch die Erforschung des Zivilschutzes könnten wir unsere Heimatfront besser zur Reparatur und Verstärkung unserer Truppen einsetzen.
column6: Cualquier avión, barco o vehículo quedará dañado en algún momento. Si investigamos la defensa civil, podremos organizar mejor nuestros frente doméstico para reparar y reforzar nuestras tropas.

column2: By concentrating on the logistical side of warfare, we can improve our support for the troops on the battlefield.

En général, ces théories sont enrichies par l'étude de technologies spécifiques. Cependant, si nous désignons des équipes pour qu'elles étudient les techniques et technologies fondamentales de ce domaine, leurs recherches enrichiront nos théories et accéléreront les autres projets de recherche appliquée.
column4: Die Theorie der Milizkriegsführung ist der Schlüssel zur Entwicklung neuer Waffen und Ausrüstungen für unsere leichten Bodentruppen wie Milizen und Garnisonstruppen. Normalerweise wird sie durch die Erforschung bestimmter Technologien erweitert, doch wenn wir Forscher im Allgemeinen an diesem Wissensbereich und der involvierten Technik arbeiten lassen würden, könnten auch andere Forschungsprojekte davon profitieren.
column6: La teoría de la milicia es esencial para desarrollar nuevas armas y equipamiento para nuestras fuerzas ligeras, como las milicias y las guarniciones. Normalmente, se mejora investigando tecnologías específicas. Aun así, si asignamos equipos a la ciencia y tecnología generales en este ámbito, su investigación mejorará nuestra teoría y acelerará otros proyectos de investigación aplicada.

column2: Casualties are a tragic consequence of war.  However, by developing combat medicine techniques and equipment, we should be able to help many injured troops, eventually allowing them to return to the front lines.
column3: Les pertes humaines sont l'une des conséquences tragiques de la guerre. En développant les techniques et l'équipement employés par la médecine militaire, nous devrions être en mesure de porter secours à de nombreuses troupes blessées pour leur permettre de retourner sur le front.
column4: Der Verlust von Menschenleben ist eine tragische Konsequenz des Krieges. Durch die Entwicklung von medizinischen Erstversorgungsmaßnahmen unter Gefechtsbedingungen und speziellen Ausrüstungen sollten wir in der Lage sein, viele verwundete Soldaten zu retten und schließlich an die Front zurückzuführen.
column6: Las bajas son una trágica consecuencia de la guerra. No obstante, con el desarrollo de las técnicas de medicina de combate, deberíamos poder ayudar a muchos heridos que, con el tiempo, podrían regresar al frente.

column2: We are dependent on our industry to produce the supplies, weapons and equipment needed for our troops.  If we send teams to help our factories, then we will be able to make them more efficient.  This will raise our industrial capacity and allow us to produce more supplies and units.
column3: Nous dépendons de notre industrie pour produire le ravitaillement, les armes et l'équipement nécessaire à nos troupes. Si nous envoyons des équipes pour aider nos usines, nous pourrons les rendre plus efficaces. Ceci augmentera notre capacité industrielle et nous donnera la possibilité de produire plus de ravitaillement et d'unités.
column4: Wir hängen zur Produktion von Waffennachschub und Ausrüstungen für unsere Truppen von unserer Industrie ab. Wenn wir Arbeitstrupps in unsere Fabriken schicken würden, könnten wir deren Effizienz steigern. Dadurch würde unsere Industriekapazität steigen, was uns die Produktion zusätzlicher Einheiten und Nachschublieferungen ermöglichen würde.
column6: Dependemos de nuestra industria para producir los suministros, las armas y el equipo necesario para las tropas. Si enviamos equipos para ayudar en nuestras fábricas, podremos hacerlas más eficientes. Esto aumentará nuestra capacidad industrial y nos permitirá producir más suministros y unidades.

column2: Automation and mass production are vital to our war industry.  We cannot produce weapons efficiently enough by making them one at a time.  By researching ways to mass produce weapons, we will be able to produce more of them.
column3: L'automatisation et la production de masse sont essentielles à notre industrie de guerre. Nous ne pouvons pas produire des armes suffisamment efficacement si nous les produisons à l'unité. En recherchant des procédés permettant d'améliorer la production d'armes en masse, nous pourrons produire plus d'armes.
column4: Atomisierung und Massenproduktion sind für unsere Kriegsindustrie unerlässlich. Waffen Stück für Stück zu produzieren ist nicht effizient genug. Durch die Erforschung zur Massenproduktion von Waffen wären wir auch in der Lage, noch mehr Waffen herzustellen.
column6: La diseminación y la producción en cadena son esenciales para nuestra economía de guerra. No podemos producir armas eficazmente si las hacemos de una en una. Si investigamos formas de producir armas en cadena, podremos fabricar más.

column2: Crude oil is of limited use until it has been refined into fuel for our troops.  Advances in chemical engineering could help improve the efficiency of our refineries.  If we develop new technologies and plants to refine oil, then we will be able to produce more fuel from the same amount of crude oil.
column3: Avant qu'il soit raffiné pour devenir du carburant pour nos troupes, l'utilisation du pétrole brut est limitée. Les progrès dans le domaine du génie chimique pourraient nous aider à améliorer l'efficacité de nos raffineries. Si nous développons de nouvelles usines pour raffiner le pétrole, nous serons alors en mesure de produire plus de carburant à partir de la même quantité de pétrole brut.
column4: Wenn wir Erdöl nicht zu Treibstoff raffinieren können, ist es für unsere Truppen von eingeschränktem Nutzen. Wenn wir neue Technologien und Anlagen zur Raffination von Erdöl entwickeln würden, könnten wir mehr Treibstoff aus derselben Menge Erdöl produzieren.
column6: El crudo es de uso limitado hasta que se refina en combustible para nuestras tropas. Los avances en la ingeniería química podrían ayudar a mejorar la eficacia de nuestras refinerías. Si desarrollamos nuevas tecnologías y plantas para refinar el crudo, produciremos más combustible con la misma cantidad de petróleo.

column2: Mining for ores can be a difficult process once the ore near the surface has been extracted.  Our improved understanding of chemical engineering means we may be able to improve our techniques and equipment.  We will then be able to recover more ore and produce more steel for our industries.
column3: Extraire des minerais peut s'avérer difficile une fois que ceux proche de la surface a été extrait. Notre meilleure compréhension du génie chimique nous permettra d'améliorer nos techniques et notre équipement. Nous serons ainsi en mesure de collecter plus de minerai et de produire plus d'acier pour nos industries.
column4: Nachdem die oberflächennahen Erzvorkommen erschöpft sind, kann der Abbau von Erzen ein schwieriges Unterfangen werden. Durch unser verbessertes Verständnis der Verfahrenstechnik könnten wir in der Lage sein, unsere Vorgehensweisen und Ausrüstungen zu verbessern. Dann wäre es uns möglich, mehr Erz abzubauen und mehr Stahl für unsere Industrie zu produzieren.
column6: La minería para recabar minerales puede ser un proceso complicado una vez extraído el mineral cercano a la superficie. La ampliación de nuestros conocimientos acerca de ingeniería química supone que podemos mejorar nuestras técnicas y equipo. Así, podremos recabar más mineral y producir más acero para nuestras industrias.

column2: Rare materials are vital for our industries to run.  Studies from other chemical engineering projects show promise for helping get more out of them.  If we improve our refining techniques, then we will have more rare materials to send to our industries.
column3: Les métaux rares sont essentiels pour faire fonctionner nos industries. L'étude d'autres projets dans le domaine du génie chimique nous promet une meilleure exploitation des matériaux rares. Si nous améliorons nos techniques de raffinage, nous pourrons transférer davantage de matériaux rares vers nos industries.
column4: Seltene Metalle sind für unsere Industrie lebenswichtig. Studien von anderen verfahrenstechnischen Projekten zeigen Möglichkeiten zur Gewinnung größerer Mengen davon auf. Wenn wir unsere Raffinationstechniken verbessern würden, könnten wir unseren Industrie mehr seltene Materialien zur Verfügung stellen.
column6: Los metales raros son esenciales para el funcionamiento de nuestras industrias. Estudios de otros proyectos de ingeniería química prometen ser de ayuda para obtener más de estos metales raros. Si mejoramos nuestras técnicas de refinado, tendremos más material que enviar a nuestras industrias.

column2: Our industries require vast amounts of coal and energy to keep running.  Our experience in chemical engineering shows we may be able do things more efficiently.  If we develop new processing techniques, we will be able to supply our industry with more power to keep the factories running.
column3: Assurer le fonctionnement de nos industries requiert de grandes quantités de charbon et d'énergie. Nos expériences en génie chimique nous ont montré que nous pourrions procéder plus efficacement. Si nous développons de nouvelles techniques de traitement, nous serons en mesure de fournir plus de puissance à notre industrie pour que les usines continuent à fonctionner.
column4: Unsere Industrie benötigt zur Beibehaltung der Produktion große Mengen an Kohle und Energie. Aufgrund unserer verfahrenstechnischen Erfahrung könnten wir in der Lage sein, effizienter zu arbeiten. Würden wir neue Kohle-Verarbeitungstechnologien entwickeln, könnten wir unserer Industrie mehr Energie zur Verfügung stellen.
column6: Nuestras industrias requieren enormes cantidades de carbón y energía para seguir funcionando. Nuestra experiencia en ingeniería química ha demostrado que podemos hacer las cosas con más eficacia. Si desarrollamos nuevas técnicas de procesado, podremos suministrar a nuestra industria más energía para que sigan funcionando las fábricas.

column2: It is often hard to find enough oil for our vehicles, ships and planes.  If we can convert our abundant energy resources into oil more efficiently, this will aid our war effort.
column3: Disposer de suffisamment de pétrole pour les véhicules, navires et avions est souvent difficile. Si nous pouvons convertir des ressources naturelles plus abondantes en pétrole, ceci contribuera à notre effort de guerre.
column4: Oft ist es sehr schwierig, genügend Öl für Schiffe und Flugzeuge bereitzustellen. Wenn wir noch mehr der im Überfluss vorhandenen Rohstoffe in Öl umwandeln könnten, würde dies unseren Kriegsbemühungen sehr helfen.
column6: A menudo cuesta tener el combustible suficiente para los vehículos, los buques y los aviones. Si podemos convertir recursos naturales más abundantes en combustible, será de ayuda para nuestro esfuerzo bélico.

column2: Supplies are everything that our troops need to survive and fight effectively, and without enough supplies they will not fight at their full capacity. If we develop techniques to improve the efficiency of our supply production, then we should be able to produce more of them and allow extra industrial capacity to be deployed for other ventures.
column3: Le ravitaillement désigne tout ce dont vos troupes ont besoin pour survivre et combattre. Un ravitaillement insuffisant ne leur permettra de combattre au maximum de leur potentiel. Si nous développons des techniques ayant pour but d'améliorer la productivité, nous serons alors en mesure de produire davantage de ravitaillement pour nos troupes et de déployer de la capacité industrielle supplémentaire pour d'autres activités.
column4: Nachschub ist alles, was unsere Truppen zum Überleben und Kämpfen benötigen - ohne Nachschub könnten sie im Kampf nicht ihr Bestes geben. Wenn wir Verfahren zur Effizienzsteigerung unserer Nachschubproduktion entwickeln würden, sollten wir mehr Nachschub für unsere Truppen produzieren können: zusätzliche Industriekapazität könnte für andere Unternehmungen eingesetzt werden.
column6: Los suministros son esenciales para la supervivencia de nuestras tropas. Sin no hay suficientes, no podrán luchar al tope de su capacidad. Si desarrollamos técnicas para mejorar la eficacia de nuestra producción de suministros, produciremos más suministros para las tropas y podremos desplegar una capacidad industrial extra en otras áreas.

The study of the ballistics of tank guns was important to the development of guns that could shoot a shell that could pierce enemy armor on the battlefield.

High velocity guns had the killing power to destroy almost any other tank on the battlefield.  These guns were usually long in length and could shoot a tank round at much high muzzle velocities resulting in flatter trajectories for accuracy and faster speeds for armor penetration.

If a high velocity gun wasn't enough, you could rule the battlefield with something bigger and more powerful, but mounting such guns required a giant turret to mount it on to and a tank chassis that could handle the recoil of such a gun.

Instead of designing a bigger tank gun, you could just take an existing anti-tank gun or anti-aircraft gun and mount it to the turret of a tank.  If successful the firepower of the tank could be increased to match the bigger guns of the heavier tanks.
Tanks built to a rugged and simple specification are easy to operate, require little education of the operators and are easy to repair but they will offer less firepower but more mobility.

Tanks built to a precise and complex specification can be made with more advanced engineering and offer better firepower and heavier protection but are far more prone to breakdown in combat conditions.

Tanks that are built with versatility in mind can be adapted for almost any situation whether is dealing with heavier more advanced tanks or overcoming terrain obstacles.  Versatality comes at the cost of having far less protection in the battlefield however.

The Christie suspension basically used springs for the chassis of the tank.  This suspension offered excellent cross-country performance but did not make a stable gun platform nor was it suitable for any tank over 30 tons.

Torsion Bar Suspension was a much better design for heavier tanks but didn't offer as much cross-country performance as a Christie Suspension.  The Torsion Bars themselves would act as springs and could offer a stable gun platform, however, torsion bars were complicated and costly to produce.  Tanks such as the Tiger used a double torsion bar system.  If the tank was hit by a mine, the torsion bars would also be difficult to repair.
Muzzle Brakes are great for reducing recoil of the main gun to maintain more accurate aim after firing each such, but muzzle brakes usually lowered overall range of the main gun.

The Commanders Cupola was an essential technology for tanks in order for them to be more efficient at what they were designed to do.  Cupola's not only added better vision for the tank commander, but also a little extra head room in the tank.
You can opt to remove certain equipment in the tank like radios, supplies, etc.. and instead load up more ammunition.  More ammunition will allow the tank crews to stay in battle for longer.

The Single Radius Steering System while better than the differential steering system was more complicated and also had some drawbacks such as reliability.  Still it offered tanks a much easier to operated steering system than before.
The Dual Radius Steering System while again being even more complicated than the single, still offers easier operation and even better reliability.

The Interleaved Road Wheel Design while offering a more stable ride, good cross-country performance and even better armor protection for the sides of the tank came at a high cost.  The design was more complicated to produce and whenever mud or frozen water would get in between the wheels, the wheels would constantly jam, making movement very difficult.
By designing Insulated Fuel Connectors you can prevent engines from catching on fire more easily.  Due to the high heat produced by tank engines, fire was always a constant danger.

A Water-Tight Engine Compartment will allow the tank to ford shallow water and rivers a lot easier but they also have a detrimental effect on heat being able to escape the engine compartment, resulting loss of power and even fire.
Engine Governors were installed in some tanks in order to prolong engine life and reliability, however limiting the rpm of the engine, also limits its performance.
Having a well designed seal on a head gasket will help to prevent pre-mature engine failures on tanks.
Multi-Stage Air Filters can help reduce the amount of dust, sand, dirt, oil, and any other kind of particulate from entering into the engine of the tank.

A Hydraulically Traversed Turret system is a system that is connected to the engine where the engine provides power to hydraulic pumps that turn the turret.  Sometimes crew would have to rev the engine to higher rpms if they wanted the turret to turn faster. In combat these could be a disadvantage as it requires close coordinated between the driver and the gunner.

Having a seperate electrical turret traversal system means that a tank gunner could turn the turret freely and independent of the engine.  Having an electrical system also means faster turret rotation but are more costly to produce due to the wiring, generators, and batteries required.
Anti-Personnel Defense systems for tanks such as automatic grenade launchers mounted on the turret of a tank can be very effective at protecting the tank from infantry.
After extensive combat experience it was found that adding ad hoc materials to the outside of the tanks could make them better protected from enemy fire.

Wet stowage consisted of surrounding the ammunition stowage bins with a water/gylcerine mixture held in an outer hollow casing. The idea was that the water mixture would pour out over any penetration of the bins by enemy AP shot/ shell fragments thereby preventing or at least slowing ammunition fires.

Armored Side Skirts can be added to tanks for better armor protection.  It was mostly effective when deflecting angle shots but tank ap shells could still penetrate the armor at close range or at perpendicular angles.
With advanced optics, tank gunners could more easily engage the enemy.  The advanced optics offered better zoom and clarity.
Sloped armor was a major advancement in tank technology.  It effectively doubled the tanks armor rating.  It was a major technological advantage for any nation that used this technology.
Wider tracks make it easier for tanks to move around on sloping terrain and in muddy conditions.

After seeing tanks perform in combat, some veterans advocated the idea of adding a rotating machine gun in the top turret of the tank for greater anti-infantry firepower.  These guns were to be very effective in adding that firepower.

The front armor on a tank is the most important but it is also where most of the weight is on the tank.  Having heavier armor on the front will offer a lot better protection but will also lead to more strain caused on the engine and transmission.
Side armor is good to have on most tank designs but will also cause the tank to move slower.
The mantlet is a good place to increase armor as it offers the turret front more protection, but more weight on the tank is always a bad thing.

As opposed to a full cable system, a pushrod and bearing flight control system offers an advantage in that they are harder to damage and offer better feedback in the flight controls to the pilot.

Instead of having all of the major systems on an aircraft powered hydraulically, some or all of them can be made to operate from electric motors instead.  Everything from the flaps, to the landing gear, to bomb bay doors.  Having electrical systems also reduces weight as the motors are generally lighter than the hydraulic pumps.

Narrow track landing gear offer an advantage in that they enable easier repair and replacement of the wings should they incur battle damage, but the narrower track makes it much more difficult to taxi and land the aircraft.  Many pilots have been killed due to the instability of a narrow landing gear track during landing.

A wide track landing setup offers much easier handing characteristics for taxi and landing operations and they are much more forgiving.  However it makes it harder to repair and replace wing sections.
By designing an aircraft with a constant speed or variable pitch propeller, the pilot can further increase the effeciency of flight allowing him to extend the range of his aircraft considerably.

Designing a new type of gunsight will make it easier for fighter pilots to track and shoot at enemy aircraft during an egagment.  Such gunsights as the reflector and gyro-stablized sights made it a lot easier to determine gun deflection.

Pressurized cockpits were designed to enable high altitude interceptor fighter the ability to better engage enemy bombers that flew at high altitudes.  With pressurized the physiological effects of high altitude flight are reduced and allows the pilot to feel more comfortable.

Nitrous Oxide increases the amount of oxygen in the fuel mixture, and thereby improved high-altitude performance. GM-1 was used on a number of modifications of existing fighter designs in order to counter the increasing performance of Allied fighters at higher altitudes.
Design a new and improved bombing sight for medium and high altitude level bombers that will improve the accuracy of the bombs that are dropped.

Automatic pullout dive brakes are an innovation that allows the dive bomber to automatically pull itself out of a dive even if the pilot blacks-out due to the heavy G-Loads assocated with pulling out of a steep dive.  This system offers a signifcant advantage in being able to accurately dive bomb a target.
The bubble cockpit is an innovation for fighter aircraft that allows the pilot to see around the aircraft with 360 degree visibility therefore increasing Situation Awareness almost exponentially.

Self Sealing Fuel tanks use rubber bladders to prevent the leaking and ignition of fuel in the fuel tanks due to enemy machine gun fire.  They represent a big leap in the survivability of an aircraft during combat but also add weight and make the aircraft have less performance.

After the use of single engine fighter in combat it was found that many times their range was too short.  Aircraft designers then came up with the idea to use a fuel tank that could be mounted on the outside of the aircraft and dropped whenever it needed to be, as in the case for entering a dogfight or using all of the fuel in the external tank.

Superchargers are designed to basically pump more air into the cylinders of an engine in order to boost its power or maintain its power at higher altitudes.  The supercharge pump itself is usually run off of a belt connected to the main crankshaft of the engine.  This can have the side effect of creating drag on the crankshaft itself and robbing the engine of some power.

Fuel injection is an innovation that greatly helps aircraft engines maintain a steady fuel flow.  Their main advantage over carborators is that they can keep providing a steady fuel flow no matter what flight regime the aircraft is in.  Where as engines equipped with carborators may have an interruption in fuel flow due to Negative G's.

With radar technology becoming more compact, they got small enough to be able to fit inside of an aircraft.  When equipped with radar, an aircraft can see much farther ahead of it where other enemy aircraft are at.  This is especially useful at night.

Equipping an aircraft with a radar that can point down and detect enemy ships and submarines means that it will allow it to find them much easier before getting into visual sight range.  This is especially useful at night.

Equipping an aircraft with a radar that can point down and search for enemy ground installations and moving targets, it allows it to find them much easier before getting into visual sight range.  This is especially useful at night.
Equipping an aircraft with a radar can also help the crew for navigation.

Radar altimeters are very useful for aircraft that fly low to the ground a lot, such as dive bombers and close air support aircraft.  A radar altimeter will allow the pilot to see his exact height over the given terrain.
Equipping an aircraft with radar detectors will allow them to know when they are being painted by enemy radar and can then either take defensive or offensive action.
Chaff are thin metal strips designed to confuse enemy radar by creating a large radar signature.  Chaff can help mask the true location of enemy aircraft in the air.
Aircraft equipped with radio navigational aids use signals from known ground station to help the pilots determine their position.  This can be especially useful for night attacks.

Transponders are a piece of electronic gear that identify to radar operators which aircraft are friendly and which are the enemy.  This can be of a great advantage to know what is going on up in the in the air to organize an offense or defense with fighters.
Putting radios in aircraft great increases their coordination and control but also alerts the enemy to the presence of them.

Intercoolers are designed for Turbocharged engines and allow cooler air to enter the intake of an engine instead of hotter air from the turbochargers.  This in effect maintains and even gives the turbocharged engine more power.

Turbochargers for aircraft engines basically take the gases from an engines exhaust valves and compresses the air and then feeds that compressed back into the engine for more efficiency thereby increasing power.  This is especially useful for high altitude flight where the air is much more thin.

MW 50 (Methanol-Wasser 50) was a 50-50 mixture of methanol and water that was often sprayed into the supercharger of World War II aircraft engines primarily for its anti-detonant effect, allowing the use of increased boost pressures. Secondary effects were cooling of the engine and charge cooling. Higher boost was only effective at altitudes below the full-throttle height, where the supercharger could still provide additional boost pressure that was otherwise wasted, while the smaller secondary effects were useful even above that altitude

Generally taken to mean the concept of fast annihilation of enemy forces is a tactical doctrine dating back to Frederick the Great. It emphasizes rapid, fluid movement to unbalance an enemy, allowing the attacker to impose his will upon the defender and avoid a stalemate. \nIt relies on uncommonly rigorous training and discipline and thoroughly professional leadership. Much of "Vernichtungsgedanke" (concept of annihilation) can be seen in Clausewitz’ classic treatise "Vom Kriege", written between 1816 and 1830.

In the last years of the war, "Stormtruppen" were trained to fight with infiltration tactics, part of the Germans' new method of attack on enemy trenches. Men trained in these methods were known in Germany as "Sturmmann", literally "Storm Man" but usually translated as "Stormtrooper". They were formed into companies of Sturmtruppen or "assault troops", more often and less exactly "Storm Troops". The infiltration tactics of the stormtroopers are still in use today in one form or another. Other armies have also used the term Assault Troops, Shock Troops or Fireteams for specialist soldiers who perform infiltration tasks.

Infiltration attacks began with brief and violent bombardments of the enemy front lines to suppress and demoralize the soldiers stationed there. The bombardment also targeted the enemy rear areas to destroy or disrupt roads, artillery, and command units. This was done to confuse the enemy, and reduce their capability to launch effective counterattacks from secondary defense lines. \nFor maximum effect, the exact points of attack remained concealed until the last possible moment. Light infantry led these attacks. They would attempt to penetrate enemy weak points to bypass and isolate heavily defended positions in the front line. Infantrymen with heavier weapons would then follow-up and have a great advantage when attacking the isolated enemy strong points.

The barrage was developed in World War I, and by late 1916 the creeping barrage was the standard means of using artillery to support an infantry attack, with the infantry following the advancing barrage as closely as possible. \nIts employment in this way recognised the importance of artillery fire in neutralising rather than destroying the enemy. It was found that a creeping barrage immediately followed by the infantry assault could be far more effective than weeks of preliminary bombardment.
The greatest generals have a grand plan for their battles, anticipating likely enemy movements and making sure there are enough troops in place to ensure victory.

Sometimes the best way to take an objective is to storm it regardless of losses. This can overwhelm the enemy and shake up their morale. If we train our units to press on boldly towards the objective they are more likely to conduct effective assaults.

A human wave attack tactic is a frontal assault by densely concentrated infantry formations against an enemy line, without attempt to shield or to mask the attacker's movement. The goal of a human wave attack is to maneuver as many men as possible into close range hoping that the shock from a large mass of attackers engaged in melee combat would force the enemy to disintegrate or fall back. The human wave attack's reliance on melee combat usually makes the organization and the training of the attacking force irrelevant, but it requires either great physical courage, coercion, or esprit-de-corps for the attackers to advance into enemy fire. However, when matched against modern weaponry such as automatic firearms, artillery and aircraft, a human wave attack is an extremely dangerous and costly tactic in the face of devastating firepower.

Banzai charge is the term used by Allied forces to refer to Japanese human wave attacks mounted by infantry units. This term came from the Japanese cry "Tenno Heika Banzai" (Long live the Emperor), shortened to "Banzai", it specifically refers to a tactic used by Japanese soldiers during the Pacific War. The banzai charge had some success at the end of a battle by assaulting the American soldiers that were unprepared for such type of attack. The banzai charge can be considered one of the least efficient strategies used in the Pacific War as shown by Japanese-to-American casualty ratios.

In mission-type tactics, the military commander gives their subordinate leaders a clearly defined goal (the mission), the forces needed to accomplish that goal, and a time frame within which the goal must be reached. The subordinate leaders then implement the order independently. The subordinate leader is given, to a large extent, the planning initiative and freedom in execution which allows a high-degree of flexibility at the operational and tactical levels of command. Mission-type Orders free the higher leadership from tactical details.

The 'Order Command' in which the executor is told not only what objective he is to achieve, but also how and with what, granting him limited freedom to respond to changing circumstances, and so to develop his own initiative and skill.

The old-style artillery barrage is outdated and cumbersome in the new age of mobile warfare. Flexible artillery based on Forward Observers (FOs) and Spotter Planes can adopt fire patterns to the specific needs to the troops as the battle unfolds.

Gone are the days when the enemy would march forward in a line for our units to shoot at over open sights. In the last war we made great use of lines of trenches and fixed positions to stop the enemy. Now, by holding the front lines lightly, with reserves sent to stop the enemy when he has committed his troops, we can conduct a more efficient, elastic defence. This means our troops will be more likely to effect a tactical withdrawal when necessary.

In warfare the Hedgehog Defence is a military tactic for defending against a mobile armoured attack, or blitzkrieg. The defenders deploy in-depth in heavily fortified positions suitable for all-around defence. The attackers can penetrate between these "hedgehogs", but each position continues to fight-on when surrounded. This keeps large numbers of attacking troops tied up attacking the well-defended strongpoints. And allowing the defenders to successfully counterattack against the units that bypass these strongpoints with their own armored reserves by cutting them off from their supporting elements.

Defence-in-depth requires that a defender deploy his resources such as fortifications, field works, and military units at and well behind the front line. Although an attacker may find it easier to breach the more-weakly defended front line, as he advances he continues to meet resistance. As he penetrates deeper, the attacker's flanks become vulnerable, and, should the advance stall, the attacker risks being enveloped. The defence-in-depth strategy is particularly effective against an attacker who is able to concentrate his forces and attack a small number of places on an extended defensive line.

The use of multiple "Pakfronts", named for "PaK" (PanzerabwehrKanone,or "tank defense cannon") incorporates the use of minefields, anti-tank ditches, and other obstacles to channel the enemy armour into their fields of fire. The method of employing Pakfronts includes establishing anti-tank zones, staggered patterns with multiple Pakgroups, anti-tank base-of-fire points, and firing sectors intertwined to amplify the effect of the tactic.

Deep operations had two phases, the tactical deep battle, followed by the exploitation of tactical success, known as the conduct of deep battle operations. Deep battle envisioned the breaking of the enemy's forward defences, or tactical zones, for fresh uncommitted mobile operational reserves to exploit by breaking into the strategic depth of an enemy front. The goal of a deep operation was to inflict a decisive strategic defeat on the enemy and render the defence of their front more difficult, impossible, or indeed, irrelevant. Unlike most other doctrines, Deep Battle stressed combined arms cooperation at all levels: strategic, operational, and tactical.

A special formation that maximizes defensive machine gun fire from the gunners on heavy bombers.  Being in close and tight flying formation means better defense for all of the aircraft as each can provide covering fire for the other.
Far less precise than daylight bombing, night bombing can be effective only if the bombers have accurate navigation.
By forming a command solely for the coordination of bombing efforts, the bomber crews can more effectively prioritize major targets.
When all else fails, just drop fire.  Fire bombs are more effective when the target area contains a lot of wooden structures, that way the fire spreads over vast areas and burns down everything.
Focus on the supply of your troops in the field from the air.
Without specialized aircraft, dropping supplies from the air can only be so effective, but once more specialized aircraft are developed supplies can be dropped mcuh more effectively.
Use heavy cargo aircraft to move large amounts of supplies to your army units.
Use transport aircraft to evacuate wounded soldiers more efficiently.
Focus on the tactical bombing of the enemy.
Concentrate on hitting enemy armies as they are moving on the ground.  This is when they are most vulnerable.
Target enemy supply depots with aircraft in order to reduce their combat effectivness.
Strike enemy aircraft that are sitting on the ground.  They can be more easily destroyed on the ground than in the air.
Strike specific installations vital to the enemy war effort.
Form a special command to coordinate all tactical strike missions in order to increase their effectiveness.
Focus on destroying the enemies army from the air.
Dive bombing became the best way to target enemy ground troops and vehicles.  Dive bombing aircraft also came to be known as aerial artillery because it could be so accurate.
Equip a team of ground troops with a radio that can observe and direct Close Air Support aircraft to specific targets on the ground.
Put your Close Air Support aircraft in direct communication and control of your ground troops through the use of tactical radios on the ground.

Put an immense amount of armor and some big cannons on it and you have a flying tank.  Too heavy to dive bomb, instead it attacks enemy tanks primary with its cannons and can take a huge amount of punishment from enemy ground fire.
Limited Wars are wars in which the entire capitulation of nations people is not required.  Limited Wars can still drag on for a long time and increase in unpopularity as time goes on however.

Your army is way too small to engage a much larger conventional army.  By instead using tactics that slowly wear down an enemy over a wide area, you can inflict a steady flow of casualties that may lead to their withdrawal due to their frustration in trying to find your forces.
Use unconventional tactics and forces against a large conventional fighting force.  Fight where they least expect you, hide so they never find you, and attack only when you know you can win.
Develop tactics to counter unconvential tactics with your conventional forces.
Search for and Destroy hard to find and well hidden enemy unconventional forces.
Focus on advanced theories and tactics related to land warfare.
Make your standard infantry formations more viable in combined arms formations and operations in an age where mechanized troops are mainly in use.
Develop Fire Teams to be adopted for use by Army units.
Decrease the size of standard Infantry Brigades and equip them with a few light vehicles to make them slightly more mobile and more combat effective.
Integrate Nuclear Armed Artillery Weapons into your Artillery Formations.  Prepare for a whole lot of radiation.
Literally Hunter-Destroyer.  Turn your Light Infantry Formations into a more combat effective fighting unit to give them more viability against armored formations.
Rely upon Consripts and Militia to be the cannon fodder and massively overwhelm enemy defensive lines in an all out frontal mass human wave attack.
Give your Marine Formations more capability when it comes to different terrain types making them more combat effective in a variety of places and not just useful for Amphibious Assaults.
Focus on using Mechanized Infantry as the main battle formations of your Army.
Turn your Mechanized units into smaller but faster and more heavily armed formations that can better engage enemy Main Battle Tanks and other enemy Mechanized Units.
Turn your whole Army into a bunch of mechanized troops.  No more walking everywhere.
Develop tactics and techniques for a new class of mechanized vehicle that can better directly support the infantry in an assault in any situation.
Equip your Airlanding Forces with light mechanized vehicles that can be paradropped into a battle zone and then manned by the paradropped infantry.
Develop new tactics related to how to best employ anti-tank missiles against enemy Main Battle Tanks.
Focus on how best to integrate the Main Battle Tank into your army for Anti-Armor and Anti-Infantry Engagements.
Turn your tank formations into a more organized group that can manuever and fight more effectively with each other.

With the advancement of Anti-Tank missiles, roaming around in a tank during the day time can be quite dangerous.  By utilizing new and advanced night vision equipment we can once again turn the tank into a potent attack weapon, but only at night.
Use your Armor Formations as a deterrent against nuclear weapons by designing them to withstand nuclear blasts and radiation protection for the crews.
Concentrate on putting more armor on your Main Battle Tanks for better protection and less manuverability.
Concentrate on putting less armor on your Main Battle Tanks for better manuverability and less protection.
Increase the tactical coordination between Main Battle Tank crews and Mechanized Infantry to better protect the tanks from anti-tank missile attacks.
Focus on using Airborne Forces in more advanced ways.
With the invention of the helicopter, the Air Cavalry can develop new tactical operations on where to land troops and assault the enemy.
Using good old fashion paradropping, but now with better more specialized transport aircraft, we can paradrop our paratroopers much faster into a combat zone.
Reinforce your ground troops with the rapid movement from helicopters.
Turn some of your helicopters in gunships to escort troop carrying helicopters and develop new tactics to use gunships to provide close air support to ground troops.
Focus on providing fast battlefield care to wounded troops in the field.
A MASH is a unit that can perform advanced triage and surgery to wounded soldiers and can pick up and move at a moments notice.
Using helicopters to transport and move wounded soldiers between friendly areas.
Form up useless Air Force personnel who have no job and put a rifle in their hand to fight the enemy.
Jet Close Air to Air Dogfighting
Jet BVR Air to Air Engagements
Fast Attack Sub vs Sub Tactics

Now that you've entered the jet age, fighter pilots are finding that air to air engagements and dogfights are more challenging.  By devloping better dogfighting tactics for jets only equipped with guns, you can ensure that that skill does not perish.

For jets equipped with missiles that can fly out and destroy targets beyond the visual range of the pilot shooting the missile, a lot more technical skill and tactics are needed to operate the radars and avionics to ensure a successful kill.

The Radar Intercept Officer or RIO, is an officer who's job it is to operate the complex radar and weapons systems of modern jet aircraft, especially for BVR engagements.  Having a good RIO can mean the difference between life and death.
Use very heavy transport aircraft to life a massive amount of supplies in an extremely well coordinated effort.
Train your pilots for the art of using their high speed jets to effectively engage ground targets in support of troops.
Use anti-radiation missiles and radar detectors to seek out and kill enemy radar stations making it safer for your Air Force to operate over enemy territory.
Equip your Close Air Support aircraft with Napalm bombs that can burn out enemy troop positions.
Use your Heavy Jet Bombers to rain death upon very large areas.
Use your helicopters to better provide Close Air Support for your ground troops.
Use Gunships that are more advanced and heavily armed to provide Direct Air Support to your Air Cavalry troops.
Use helicopters to increase the survival rate of wounded troops exponentially because helicopters can land pretty much anywhere to extract the wounded.
Use helicopters to conduct Search and Rescue of downed aircrewmen in enemy territory.
Develop new tactics for targeting, launching, shooting, and destroying enemy ships with surface to surface guided missiles.
Develop new tactics for defence against incoming guided missiles targeted at your ships.
Launch a massive helicopter borne assault from naval ships onto an enemy beachhead.
Develop new tactics for Fast Attack submarines to attack enemy surface naval ships.
Develop new tactics for Fast Attack submarines to attack and defend against other enemy Fast Attack Submarines.
Organize the Aircraft Carrier into a Battlegroup with other navy ships to enable the formation to conduct a wide variety of missions.
Develop new tactics for surface ships to hunt and kill enemy Fast Attack Submarines.

Develop new tactics for helicopters equipped with anti-submarine weapons to hunt and kill enemy Fast Attack Submarines.  These helicopters are usually based on Aircraft Carriers or later one small destroyers and cruisers.
Better command structure at the Brigade and Regimental level gives certain advantages to the troops on the ground. Faster response times and decision making help to give unit actions an edge.

Generally the smallest form of an independant unit able to fight on its own and maintain unit integrity. Better command structure will increase the effectivness of the various units under the division's control.

Multiple division command requires considerable unit coodination and communication. A more effective command structure at the Corps level allows multiple division-sized assets to fight and defend in an organized manner.
Basic operational warfare requires an army-level command structure. These commands might control upwards of 100,000 men and require a sophisticated control of units and supplies.
The fate of the entire nation rests on the decisions made at the strategic command level.

Controlling multiple armies on the strategic level requires almost as much grasp of political implications as it does military concerns. it is on this level that the broad direction of a nation's land warfare is decided. Often with important political results.
Coordination of the various armed forces can be complex and politically fraught with danger. The cooperation of the different branches of the military can never be taken for granted.
Politically indoctrinated troops will fight often, fight longer and harder, but can also become less responsive to military tactics.
Placing political advisors within the military ensures a level of organization is maintained often through fear of the regime responsible. The damage to the morale of the troops can be severe.

The Kampfgruppe was an ad-hoc combined arms formation, usually employing a combination of tanks, infantry, and artillery elements, generally organised for a particular task or operation. Kampfgruppen were generally referred to by either their commanding officer's name or the parent division. Hundreds of Kampfgruppen are documented to have taken part in operations and they left a significant impact in popular culture and the picture of the Second World War.
